title: Tony Marchi
text:
Anthony Marchi (born 21 January 1933) is an English retired <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and manager, who played for <a href="Tottenham%20Hotspur%20F.C.">Tottenham Hotspur</a> in the position of <a href="wing%20half">wing half</a> from 1950 until 1965, which was broken up by a two-year spell in Italy with <a href="Vicenza%20Calcio">Vicenza</a> and <a href="Torino%20F.C.">Torino</a>. During much of his career at Spurs, Marchi was mostly used as an understudy to <a href="Danny%20Blanchflower">Danny Blanchflower</a> and <a href="Dave%20Mackay">Dave Mackay</a>. However, in the 1962-63 following injuries he established himself in the side and was a member of the <a href="1963%20UEFA%20Cup%20Winners%27%20Cup%20Final">1963 UEFA Cup Winners' Cup Final</a> winning team. He was one of seventeen players used by Spurs in their <a href="Double%20%28association%20football%29">Double</a> winning side of 1960–61- He also later managed <a href="Cambridge%20City%20F.C.">Cambridge City</a> and <a href="Northampton%20Town%20F.C.">Northampton Town</a>.
Honours.
Tottenham Hotspur
